CreatingIconsInBlender

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Scene Setup

1. First off set your camera to the desired size under the render buttons. (i.e. 128x128)

2. Rotate/Move the object in order to make it fit nicely into the rendered image.

3. Add Lighting to your scene. Personally I go for a setup with three spots, the strongest (energy 1.8) set up directly behind the camera, pointing at the object, the other two (Energy 0.2-0.3) set up to lighten the object from the side and a bit from behind.


Render Setup

4. Remove the World Texture. (Material Buttons - > World Texture - > Remove Button)

5. Set Image Format to PNG and Mode to RGBA.

6. Activate Edge-Drawing. (Toy with settings if you feel like it)

7. Render. (The image will most likely appear to have a black background, however the background is actually transparent.)

8. Save Render.

Where to go from now

Postprocess in Gimp if you feel like it. Theoretically the image should also be suitable for tracing in Inkscape.
